text: Brussels-Central railway station (, ) is a railway and metro station in central Brussels, Belgium. It is the second busiest railway station in Belgium and one of three main railway stations in Brussels, together with Brussels- South and Brussels-North. First completed in 1952 after protracted delays caused by economic difficulties and World War II, it is the newest of Brussels' main rail stations. Brussels-Central is connected to the rapid transit Gare Centrale/Centraal Station station on lines 1 and 5 of the Brussels Metro system, and serves as an important node of the Brussels Intercommunal Transport Company. == Notes == ==References== Category:1952 establishments in Europe Category:1950s establishments in Belgium Category:Railway stations in Belgium Category:Buildings and structures in Brussels
title: Brussels-Central railway station
